intro: Pseudognaphalium ramosissimum, commonly known as the hairy goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are usually hairy and gray-green, providing a distinguishing feature. Pseudognaphalium ramosissimum is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
